examples.sentence: I hailed a cab using Didi Dache in 0.3 seconds during rush hour.
The cab driver knew every hutong in Beijing like his own palm.
Tourists enjoy romantic rides in horse-drawn cabs around Central Park.
The cab's wheels made crunching sounds on the cobblestone street.
We cabbed to the opera house to avoid subway transfers.
After midnight revellers cabbed home through neon-lit streets.
The cab stand near Beijing Hotel always has long queues.
My cab fare from Pudong Airport cost a week's lunch money.
The Illuminati is often portrayed as a shadowy cabal in movies.
Ancient alchemists formed cabals to protect their recipes.
The Watergate scandal revealed a presidential cabal.
Twitter users love to expose celebrity cabals.
Politicians caballed behind closed doors before the vote.
The CEOs were caught caballing against labor unions.
Disgruntled generals formed a cabal to overthrow the government.
The board members caballed against the founder.
The caballero tipped his hat to ladies with perfect Cervantes-style manners.
As a true caballero, he always pays for the entire table's tapas.
Don Quixote imagined himself as a caballero fighting windmills.
The caballeros in armor still parade during Toledo's medieval festivals.
The caballero performed breathtaking equestrian stunts at the feria.
Every Andalusian caballero learns to ride before he can walk.
The novel describes a caballero andante traveling through La Mancha.
The Moulin Rouge is the most famous cabaret in Paris, where tourists queue for hours to see the can-can dance.
He proposed to her at a dimly lit cabaret while jazz musicians played 'La Vie en Rose'.
The cabaret at this Berlin club features aerial silk performers and fire-eaters.
Modern cabaret often blends burlesque with political satire, like a spicy hotpot of entertainment.
The Shanghai cabaret show recreates 1930s Shanghai style with qipao-clad singers.
As a cabaret singer, she mastered the art of whispering jazz standards while balancing a champagne glass on her head.
The street vendor chopped cabbage with lightning speed for hotpot ingredients.
Her homemade kimchi uses three types of cabbage for extra crunch.
Children mistook the cabbage patch for giant green roses.
The Polish restaurant's stuffed cabbage tastes like grandma's recipe.
The Victorian cabbie tipped his hat to the ladies.
Cabbies in London used to carry hay for their horses.
The New York cabbie knew every shortcut in Manhattan.
My cabbie told me hilarious stories about midnight fares.
The cabby knew every shortcut in Beijing like the back of his hand.
A Shanghai cabby once drove me across the city for just 50 yuan during a typhoon.
Victorian cabbies wore top hats and carried whips.
The cabby shouted 'Whoa!' as his horse stopped abruptly near Hyde Park.
My chatty cabby explained Chengdu's history while weaving through traffic.
The influencer's log cabin went viral for its minimalist design.
Mushroom-shaped cabins are trending in rural tourism.
Economy cabin passengers can now pre-order bubble tea on flights.
The first-class cabin turns into a mahjong room after dinner.
The writer cabinned himself for three months to finish the novel.
During quarantine, we're all essentially cabinned in our homes.
Cabin crew members now demonstrate TikTok dances for safety instructions.
After 14-day quarantine, everyone in our compound got cabin fever.
The antique medicine cabinet still smells of herbs from 1920s Shanghai.
Her makeup cabinet is organized like a museum display.
The new cabinet members took group photos with Peking Opera faces.
During the crisis, the cabinet met in an underground bunker.
Cabinet reshuffles are more dramatic than Korean dramas.
The cabinet decision triggered memes across social media.
This cabinet-grade mahogany costs more per kg than beef.
The cabinet maker carved moon gates into the wardrobe doors.
Her kitchen cabinet holds 50 types of chili sauce.
The shadow cabinet rehearses debates like stand-up comedians.
The cabinetmaker restored the antique mahogany desk using traditional techniques.
As a cabinetmaker, she specializes in minimalist Scandinavian designs.
The cabinetmaker spent three months carving intricate floral patterns on this wardrobe.
Unlike carpenters, cabinetmakers focus on precise joinery without nails.
The Ming-style chair was crafted by a 70-year-old master cabinetmaker.
The cat chewed through my laptop charging cable again.
Fiber optic cables carry TikTok videos at light speed.
The Titanic sent distress cables before sinking.
In 1866, the first transatlantic cable changed global communication.
Tourists scream when the cable car sways over the canyon.
The suspension bridge's main cable is thicker than a giant panda.
The elevator cable snapped in the action movie scene.
Yachts are secured to the dock with steel cables.
Marconi cabled across the Atlantic in 1901.
Before emails, people cabled urgent messages.
The embassy cabled the evacuation order.
Reporters cabled breaking news in Morse code.
Workers cabled the Christmas tree to the roof of the car.
The kidnapper cabled the victim to a chair.
My grandma still pays for cable TV to watch Peking opera.
Her cable knit sweater smells like mothballs.
The cabling in this old building needs urgent upgrading to support 5G networks.
Hidden cabling behind walls is like the nervous system of a smart home.
The studio's cabling was so tangled it looked like a bowl of instant noodles.
Fiber optic cabling has replaced copper wires in most data centers.
Structured cabling makes office relocation as easy as Lego blocks.
The cabling work delayed by two weeks because workers kept getting tangled in wires.
The yellow cabriolet speeding along the coast looked like a moving sunflower.
Her dream was to cruise California's Highway 1 in a vintage cabriolet.
The cabriolet roof retracts in just 15 seconds - faster than making instant noodles!
The fox's cache was found under a pile of autumn leaves.
Pirates used this cave as a cache for stolen spices.
Squirrels' nut caches help forests grow naturally.
The explorer survived winter with his cache of dried meat.
The spy cached microfilms inside a hollowed-out book.
Grandma caches her savings in different cookie jars.
Bears cache in fat reserves before hibernation.
Your phone's cache memory makes apps load faster.

examples.sentence: The imperial cachet on this document proves its authenticity.
Breaking the cachet on liquor bottles is every child's temptation.
His personal cachet with a dragon design is famous among collectors.
The wax cachet melted when exposed to Beijing's summer heat.
That red ribbon is the cachet of premium Wuliangye liquor.
The panda-shaped cachet distinguishes authentic Sichuan peppercorns.
Peking University's cachet helps graduates land dream jobs.
The cachet of Huawei's engineer team is globally recognized.
The Year of Rabbit cachet made this stamp collection valuable.
Tourists queue for hours to get the Great Wall cachet.
Didi's safety upgrade now has real cachet among users.
Jack Ma's speech lent cachet to the entrepreneurship competition.
Grandma's cackling while watching Xiaohongshu comedy videos shakes the sofa.
The AI voice assistant suddenly started cackling like a hen.
The live-streamer kept cackling about her new lipstick shade for 20 minutes.
Aunties cackling over mahjong tiles sounded like a parrot convention.
The villain's cackling laughter in the drama made viewers mute their TVs.
The cackle of hens echoed through the morning market.
His cackle sounded like a malfunctioning printer.
The villain's cackle sent shivers down my spine.
Her cackle could be heard three tables away in the hotpot restaurant.
The tea house was full of the cackle of retired uncles.
Her cackle with neighbors lasted longer than the Spring Festival Gala.
The geese cackled angrily at the delivery robot.
Chickens cackle loudly after laying eggs, like announcing a major achievement.
The aunties cackled while watching the dating show.
He cackled like a villain when his meme went viral.
The livestream host cackled nonstop about double eleven discounts.
My math teacher cackled through the entire class like a human radio.
The boss said 'cut the cackle' when we discussed milk tea brands.

examples.sentence: The cacophonous mix of construction noise and car horns made my headache worse.
His cacophonous attempt at singing Peking opera scared the neighbor's cat.
The cacophonous debate in parliament sounded like a poultry market.
That cacophonous heavy metal band actually uses farm tools as instruments.
Her cacophonous laughter during the serious meeting was like nails on a chalkboard.

examples.sentence: The cacophony of nails on a chalkboard made everyone cringe.
His attempt at opera singing resulted in pure cacophony.
The avant-garde composer deliberately used cacophony in the symphony.
The cacophony of car horns during rush hour was unbearable.
The cacophony of the construction site next door ruined my Zoom meeting.
A sudden cacophony of fireworks startled the sleeping baby.

examples.sentence: The cactus in my dorm survived 3 months without water, just like my love life.
She collects cactus-shaped USB drives, calling them 'the least prickly cacti'.
The cocktail with cactus juice turned my tongue slightly blue - totally Instagram worthy!
That cad promised marriage but ran away with her savings.
In Victorian novels, cads often wear fancy mustaches.
Modern architects use CAD to design skyscrapers that look like giant dumplings.
Learning CAD is as essential for engineers as chopsticks are for eating noodles.
This CAD software can render your blueprint in 3D while you drink bubble tea.
The forensic team examined the cadaver under purple LED lights.
Medical students nicknamed their practice cadaver 'Professor Bones'.
The cadaver dissection class smells like formalin and courage.
After pulling three all-nighters, his face looked cadaverous under the office lights.
The vampire in the drama appeared with cadaverous makeup that scared children.
The abandoned hospital had a cadaverous smell that made people gag.
Her cadaverous thinness after the diet shocked her friends.

examples.sentence: The golf champion tipped his caddie with a limited edition Rolex.
Smart caddies can calculate wind speed using grass blades.
He caddied for Tiger Woods during his college summer break.
Many golf pros started by caddying at country clubs.
The robotic caddie cart follows players like a loyal duckling.
Trout fishermen often use artificial caddis flies as bait.
The caddis larvae build protective cases from tiny stones.
She keeps her jewelry in a silver caddy shaped like a panda.
The carpenter made a wooden caddy for chess pieces.
The antique caddy preserves pu'er tea's aroma perfectly.
He accidentally broke the lid of his grandmother's porcelain tea caddy.
The cadence of ancient Chinese poems makes them sound like songs.
Her voice had the cadence of a lullaby when reading bedtime stories.
Peking opera performers master the cadence of every syllable.
The cadence of his southern accent made his speech musical.
The cadence of this folk song imitates flowing water.
WeChat voice messages often capture the unique cadence of laughter.
The cadence of typing sounds like raindrops on the roof.
Drummers control the cadence of the entire marching band.
The grandma danced with cadence to the square music.

examples.sentence: The cadet polished his boots until they reflected his determined face.
Cadets at Whampoa Military Academy famously ate breakfast in 3 minutes flat.
Our school's cadet corps won the national drill competition.
The disheveled man cadged for coins near the subway station.
In Victorian London, children often cadged by singing carols.
He cadged a cigarette from the convenience store clerk.
My roommate always cadges my charging cable without asking.
Street vendors cadged counterfeit handbags to tourists.
In 1920s Chicago, gangsters cadged illegal alcohol.
Stop cadging off your parents' Netflix account!

Old batteries must be recycled properly due to their cadmium content.
The steel cadre of the Bird's Nest Stadium reflects traditional Chinese ceramics.

The Caesarean laurel wreath became a symbol of imperial power.
This coin features typical Caesarean facial profiles.
The Caesarean legions conquered half of Europe.
Ancient Roman roads demonstrate Caesarean engineering brilliance.
Modern dictators often dream of being Caesareans.
The protestors condemned the mayor as a petty Caesarean.
The panda at Beijing Zoo delivered twins via Caesarean section.
The caesura in Li Bai's poem creates dramatic tension like a guzheng's sudden silence.
Modern rap battles use caesurae as effectively as ancient epic poetry.
The 2008 Olympics opening ceremony had a deliberate caesura before the scroll unfurled.
Her speech included a caesura so long that people thought the mic was broken.
Zhuge Liang's empty city stratagem relied on a rhetorical caesura in military action.

The roadside cafe serves the best jianbing in the neighborhood.
Midnight cafes near universities always have spicy crayfish.

The school cafeteria's mystery meat became legendary among students.
Caffeine makes pandas stay awake just like humans, though they mainly eat bamboo.

examples.sentence: The cagey fox stole sausages without triggering the alarm.
He gave a cagey smile when asked about the missing cookies.
Cagey meerkats always have a sentinel watching for eagles.
She stayed cagey during the negotiation like a poker player.

Tourists should stay cagey about street vendors in crowded areas.

He grew cagey when his mom mentioned the broken vase.

His cagey response made it clear he wouldn't lend his gaming console.

The pickpocket was cagey as a fox in the subway crowd.

A cake of Sichuan pepper-scented soap sat by the sink.
Tea cakes from Yunnan can age like fine wine.

Her makeup caked under the stage lights.
Solving this math problem? Piece of cake!
The final exam was a cake walk for the straight-A student.

examples.sentence: The pink calamine lotion saved me from mosquito bites during summer camping.
Grandma's first-aid kit always contains calamine for skin irritation.
The geologist identified sparkling calamine deposits in the cave.
Ancient alchemists mistook calamine for philosopher's stone ingredient.
After hugging a caterpillar, the kid was covered in calamine lotion.
The calamitous earthquake left entire villages buried under mud.
His decision to invest in turtle-speed cryptocurrency proved calamitous.
The calamitous loss of the panda cub brought tears to the zookeepers.
It was calamitous when the internet cut off during the online game finals.
Forgetting to save the 10,000-word thesis was a calamitous mistake.
The Sichuan earthquake in 2008 was a national calamity.
Forgetting to save the 10,000-word thesis before power outage was a digital calamity.
Spilling hotpot soup on white shirt before date was a social calamity.
The real calamity wasn't losing the game, but the livestream going viral.
Flood control systems minimize damage from natural calamities.
Paleontologists found calcareous in dinosaur fossils from Sichuan.
The calcareous gives seahorses their unique skeletal structure.
Guilin's calcareous mountains create surreal karst landscapes.
The calcareous soil makes perfect conditions for growing lychees.
Calcareous deposits in kettles look like tiny snow mountains.
Tofu becomes more nutritious when made with calcareous water.
The ancient seashells calcified over millions of years.
His arteries began to calcify after years of consuming milk tea.
The mineral water here can calcify your kettle within months.
Doctors warned that vaping may calcify lung tissues.
His calcified thinking made him reject all new tech trends.
The cave walls glittered with calcite crystals like natural disco balls.
Chalkboards were originally made from calcite-rich limestone.
The calcium in milk helps build strong bones like those of dinosaurs.
Chinese tofu is richer in calcium than most cheeses.
Cracking knuckles doesn't actually cause calcium deficiency.
The calories in this hot pot are hardly calculable due to unlimited refills.
With big data, even public opinion trends become calculable.
His promise is as calculable as sunrise in the Sahara.
We need calculable teammates when climbing Mount Everest.

examples.sentence: The AI calculates pi to 100 trillion digits while you blink.
Grandma still calculates grocery costs with an abacus.
Meteorologists calculated the typhoon would hit chicken drumstick-shaped Taiwan.
The algorithm calculates your next online purchase with 90% accuracy.
They calculated the project timeline down to hotpot breaks.
The squirrel calculated its winter nut storage like a Wall Street broker.
I calculate to visit all stinky tofu stands in this night market.
The cat calculated to knock over the vase at 3am sharp.
You can't calculate on your goldfish remembering feeding time.
Eating 10 spicy hotpot dips was a calculated risk for the influencer.
Her calculated decision to major in AI paid off with a 500k job offer.
The CEO made a calculated move by acquiring that startup.
The apology letter had just the right calculated tone.
His calculated silence spoke louder than words.
The calculated trajectory enabled Chang'e-5 to return from the moon.
This graph shows calculated probabilities of rain.
Launching Douyin was ByteDance's brilliant calculated risk.
The calculating speed of this abacus surprises mathematicians.
Her calculating gaze scanned the supermarket discounts like a barcode reader.
He gave a calculating smile when dividing the hotpot ingredients.
The calculating colleague always 'forgets' his wallet at team dinners.
The calculating general moved chess pieces like commanding troops.
Her calculating preparation included bribing the cat with treats.
The AI's calculation speed surpasses human accountants by 1000 times.
Her mental calculation of the hotpot bill shocked everyone.
After careful calculation, he chose the job with free milk tea.
Political calculations often outweigh moral concerns.
The final calculation showed we ordered 15 plates of wagyu beef.
According to my calculations, we'll run out of mooncakes by mid-autumn.
The villain's cold calculation ignored human feelings.
A quick calculation told me the discount wasn't real.
The ancient Egyptian calculator used hieroglyphs to record harvest yields.
Before computers, human calculators were employed for complex equations.
My solar-powered calculator survived 3 years of math classes.
The teacher confiscated the calculator that could play Tetris.
He still keeps his 1980s pocket calculator as a vintage collection.
The calculator watch was considered high-tech in primary school.
The doctor found renal calculus during my physical exam.
Ancient medical texts described bladder calculus as 'pebbles in wine'.
Newton developed calculus to calculate planetary orbits.
Freshmen often struggle with the epsilon-delta definition in calculus.
Differential calculus helps optimize Douyin's recommendation algorithm.
Drinking boba tea excessively may increase risk of urinary calculus.
The Yellowstone caldera could theoretically erupt with 2,000 times the force of Mount St. Helens.
Local legends say the caldera is a giant's cooking pot for boiling clouds.
The Heaven Lake in Changbai Mountain is actually a stunning caldera lake.
Caldera lakes often have unexpectedly deep blue water due to mineral deposits.
The museum displays Caledonian artifacts from the Iron Age.
Caledonian warriors painted themselves blue before battles.
Edinburgh's Caledonian Hotel serves haggis with whisky sauce.
The Caledonian Railway connects Glasgow to the Highlands.
Caledonians resisted Roman invasion for centuries.
The Caledonians built impressive stone towers called brochs.
Modern Caledonians celebrate Burns Night with poetry readings.
As a proud Caledonian, he always wears a kilt at weddings.

examples.sentence: The panda-themed calendar counts down to Spring Festival.
Ancient Chinese invented the lunisolar calendar earlier than Europe.
Her Douyin livestream calendar is packed every weekend.
Sync the meeting calendar with your smartwatch.
The museum calendars traditional tea ceremonies on lunar holidays.
All imported goods must be calendared for customs inspection.
Mid-Autumn Festival falls on the 15th day of the 8th lunar calendar month.
Chinese companies often use both Gregorian and lunar calendar years.

examples.sentence: The textile factory just imported a German calender worth 2 million RMB.
Operators must wear gloves when feeding fabric into the calender.
This luxury packaging paper is calendered three times for extra gloss.
The artisan calendered the leather until it shone like a mirror.
The farmer bottle-feeds the calf like a giant milk tea.
Moo-ve over! This calf is learning to TikTok dance.
Her designer bag is made of Italian calf leather.
Calfskin gloves are as soft as steamed milk pudding.
After climbing Mount Tai, my calves screamed louder than the monkeys.
Yoga pants highlight her toned calves like two steamed buns.
Their calf love began during mahjong classes.
Some influencers worship the golden calf on Xiaohongshu.
Ancient gunsmiths calibrated cannons using lead balls.
The sniper calibrated his rifle barrel with laser precision.
Techs calibrate those smart scales with 10kg rice bags.
My Apple Watch needs calibrating after it counted 300 steps while I was sleeping.
The new law calibrates food safety standards across provinces.
WeChat calibrates emoji sizes on different phones.
Grandma calibrated her TV settings to maximum brightness.
I'm calibrating my expectations after seeing the rent price.
The lab calibrated their thermometers against the national standard.
Tesla's self-calibrating cameras adjust to weather conditions.
The atomic clock is calibrated to lose only 1 second every 100 million years.
My grandma's vintage radio needs to be calibrated weekly like feeding a pet.
All COVID test kits must be calibrated against WHO standards.
The AI's moral compass is being calibrated with 5000 ethical dilemmas.
A poorly calibrated speedometer once made me think my e-bike could fly.
The dumpling robot's folding is precisely calibrated to 18 pleats like a master chef.
The calibration of this antique cannon revealed its Qing Dynasty origin.
Precise calibration of telescope lenses requires sub-micrometer accuracy.
The calibration on this traditional Chinese medicine scale uses ancient liang units.
Before digital era, engineers relied on vernier calibration for measurements.
The calibration of high-speed rail tracks ensures bullet trains run smoothly.
Smartphone gyroscopes need weekly calibration for accurate AR games.
Perform zero calibration before weighing gold at pawn shops.
The sniper checked the 7.62mm calibre of his rifle.
This antique cannon has an unusual oval calibre.
Her calibre in AI research impressed the Turing Award committee.
We're recruiting engineers of the highest calibre.
The calibre of this year's Lantern Festival designs is exceptional.
This tea house serves oolong of international calibre.
Peking University attracts high-calibre students globally.
Huawei's 5G technology meets the calibre of excellence.
The vintage qipao was made from Japanese calico with cherry blossom patterns.
Grandma's calico apron looked like a moving flower garden.
Traditional Chinese medicine bags are often sewn from unbleached calico.
Artists prefer calico for canvas because of its natural texture.
The calico cat napping on the rice bag became the shop's mascot.
A true Californian knows where to find the best avocado toast in LA.
When two Californians meet abroad, they immediately discuss earthquake experiences.
The Californian sunshine makes solar panels extremely efficient here.
Her Californian accent disappears when she orders boba tea.
Yoga on the beach at sunrise is the ultimate Californian lifestyle.
The machinist used a digital caliper to measure the piston diameter with 0.001mm precision.
Ancient Chinese bronze calipers from the Han dynasty are displayed in the National Museum.
Bike mechanics always keep brake calipers clean for optimal performance.
The red Brembo calipers on his sports car cost more than my monthly rent.
Archaeologists carefully calipered the Terracotta Warrior's facial features.
Before 3D printing, engineers must caliper the prototype manually.
Every middle school physics lab in China has at least ten vernier calipers.
The squeaking sound indicates your brake calipers need lubrication.
The first caliph Abu Bakr succeeded Prophet Muhammad in 632 AD.
The Ottoman sultans claimed to be caliphs until 1924.
The Abbasid Caliphate built the House of Wisdom in Baghdad.
The concept of caliphate still influences modern Islamic politics.
The panda keeper made a special call to summon Mei Lan for dinner.
We heard the call of wild swans over Kunming Lake.
The CEO paid a surprise call to the R&D department during lunch break.
In ancient times, scholars would make formal calls with name cards.
I got a 3AM call from my friend who forgot the time difference.
The customer service call lasted 48 minutes and 33 seconds.
The 'Clear Your Plate' call reduced food waste by 30%.
Greta's climate call ignited global student strikes.
Call me when your high-speed train arrives at Xi'an.
The captain called everyone's name during the lifeboat drill.
She called 120 immediately when seeing the car accident.
My mom calls me every day at exactly 19:00 Beijing time.
The street vendor is calling out prices like a rapper.
No calling in the library except for fire emergencies!
The British ambassador will call on the mayor tomorrow.
We called at three teahouses along Pingjiang Road.
The recipe calls for exactly 108 sesame seeds.
After selling 200 stinky tofu portions, the vendor called it a day.

examples.sentence: The calla lilies by West Lake look like white swans dancing on water.
Chefs use calla leaves to wrap sticky rice in traditional Dongting cuisine.
Her bridal bouquet featured callas shaped like champagne glasses.
The black calla is as rare as panda in the flower world.
The calla lily emoji is Instagram influencers' favorite decoration.
The called number was busy for three hours - it must be a hotline for PS5 preorders.
All called taxis should arrive within 8 minutes according to Didi's promise.
The so-called '5G chicken' turned out to be just regular fried chicken with more expensive packaging.
The mysterious caller left a box of stinky tofu at my door.
Spring Festival callers always bring red envelopes and mandarin oranges.
The mahjong caller announced 'Pong!' loudly in the teahouse.
As the dragon boat caller, he leads the rhythm with a drum.
The court caller shouted 'All rise!' in perfect Mandarin.
The hospital caller announces numbers like a Peking opera singer.
Caller fish at the morning market still jumps out of the basin.
Grandma prefers caller vegetables from her rooftop garden.
My phone shows 'Scam Risk' on caller ID for unknown numbers.
The calligrapher dipped his wolf-hair brush into midnight-black ink.
Wang Xizhi is considered the greatest calligrapher in Chinese history.
The master calligrapher's work was displayed in the Forbidden City.
The Starbucks in Beijing offers calligraphic coffee cups during Spring Festival.
Her WeChat moments look like a calligraphic masterpiece.
The new Huawei font imitates Wang Xizhi's calligraphic style.
The doctor's calligraphy looks like ECG waveforms.
Her calligraphy on love letters made his heart flutter.
Wang Xizhi's calligraphy is worth millions per character.
During Spring Festival, streets are filled with red paper and golden calligraphy.
Learning Chinese calligraphy requires liters of ink and tons of patience.
His calligraphy brush danced like a drunken dragon on paper.

examples.sentence: Teaching is not just a job but a calling for her.
Many doctors feel their calling during the pandemic.
In the calling of catering, midnight food preparation is common.
The tech calling attracts those who love innovation.
The calling of cranes echoes over the wetland.
We heard the distant calling of mountain goats.
The general issued a calling of all reserves.
The emergency calling brought volunteers within hours.
His witty humor became his calling card in negotiations.

examples.sentence: His callous reaction to the orphan's story shocked everyone.
The CEO's callous dismissal of layoffs went viral on Douyin.
Farmers develop callous hands from harvesting corn.
The callous texture of this durian shell can puncture tires.
Years of guitar playing calloused his fingertips.
Barefoot running gradually calloused her soles.
The landlord showed callous disregard for tenants' safety.
His callous attitude towards stray animals angered netizens.
The farmer's calloused hands could crush walnuts barehanded.
Her calloused fingertips from guzheng practice created unique fingerprints.
Rock climbers develop calloused palms like crocodile skin.
The Peking opera performer's calloused feet could walk on broken glass.
Years of kung fu training had calloused his knuckles into iron hammers.
The leather was calloused by exposure to desert winds.
War had calloused his heart to human suffering.
Too much online trolling can callouse one's empathy.
The wound calloused over but left a moon-shaped scar.

examples.sentence: The landlord callously raised rents during the pandemic.
She callously deleted her boyfriend's entire anime collection.
Tourists callously stepped on coral reefs for selfies.
He callously scrolled past donation pleas for stray cats.
The CEO acted callously by firing employees via Zoom.

examples.sentence: The callow intern accidentally sent a meme to the CEO's work group.
His callow attempts at flirting were like a panda trying to dance.
The callow sparrows in the nest were chirping for food.
We found a callow owl chick that had fallen from its tree.
The calm of the library was broken by a sneeze.
There's an eerie calm before the typhoon hits.
Fishermen took advantage of the calm to repair their nets.
The South China Sea is rarely in complete calm.
Keep calm and drink boba tea.
Her calm voice soothed the crying baby.
The surgeon remained calm during the 12-hour operation.
A calm poker face is essential when playing mahjong.
The excited puppy finally calmed after chewing three slippers.
Stock markets calmed following the policy announcement.
She calmed the angry customer with free milk tea coupons.
Traditional Chinese medicine uses chrysanthemum tea to calm nerves.
Calm down! Losing one round of Honor of Kings isn't the end of the world.
The teacher asked the students to calm down before the exam.
Sailors fear dead calm more than storms sometimes.
The lake was in dead calm at dawn.
